summary: Email correspondence between defense attorney Lloyd Epstein and a federal prosecutor (USAO-NYS) regarding a request to adjourn the criminal case of Allan Guerrero due to Guerrero's recovery from a traffic accident. The prosecutor consents to the adjournment.

persons.name: Lloyd Epstein
persons.context: Attorney representing Allan Guerrero, requesting an adjournment of Guerrero's criminal case due to his client's recovery from a traffic accident.

persons.name: Allan Guerrero
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case United States v. Allan Guerrero (Dkt. No. 14 Cr. 617 (RMB)), who is recovering from a bad traffic accident, necessitating the adjournment request.

connections.description: Epstein is the defense attorney representing Guerrero in his federal criminal case, as evidenced by him requesting an adjournment on Guerrero's behalf.

events.title: Adjournment Request for Guerrero Case
events.description: Defense attorney Lloyd Epstein emails a federal prosecutor to request a one-month adjournment of the criminal case against Allan Guerrero, citing Guerrero's ongoing recovery from a bad traffic accident. The prosecutor consents.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain concerning the federal criminal case United States v. Allan Guerrero (Docket No. 14 Cr. 617 (RMB)).
Defendant Allan Guerrero was involved in a 'bad traffic accident' and was still not fully recovered as of September 15, 2016.
Defense attorney Lloyd Epstein successfully obtained the prosecution's consent to adjourn the case for another month.
The correspondence is between a defense attorney and a federal prosecutor from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO-NYS), whose name is redacted in the text.
